Description: Flipkart is running a smartphone sale called the Flagship Fest. The sale started today and will continue till May 14. As part of the sale, buyers will get a 10% instant discount on Citibank credit and debit cards. There is also an extra Rs 500 off on EMI transactions above Rs 20,000 made using the bank’s card
Text:
Flipkart is running a smartphone sale called the Flagship Fest. The sale started today and will continue till ... Read More

Online commerce website Flipkart is running a smartphone sale called the Flagship Fest. The sale started today and will continue till May 14. As part of the sale, buyers will get a 10% instant discount on Citibank credit and debit cards. There is also an extra Rs 500 off on EMI transactions above Rs 20,000 made using the bank’s cards.

Here is a list of phones that you may consider buying

Apple iPhone 12 : Available at Rs 77,990 onwards

Apple iPhone 12 comes with a starting price of Rs 77,990. In the sale, the phone is selling at a discount of Rs 6,000 on HDFC Bank card purchase. Easy purchase options include both zero-cost EMI and standard EMI. no-cost EMI for the phone starts at Rs 12,984 per month.

Motorola Razr 4G: Available at Rs 54,999

After a 63% off on its original price, Motorola Razr 4G phone can be purchased at Rs 54,999. The foldable phone features a 6.2-inch screen and packs 6GB RAM with 128GB storage.

Apple iPhone 12 Pro : Available at Rs 1,10,900 onwards

Buyers can get Rs 5,000 off on iPhone 12 Pro using HDFC Bank credit card. With the bank offer, the phone’s price reduces to Rs 1,10,900 for the base model. One can also get an exchange discount of up to Rs 15,150 on the phone by giving old smartphones.

Asus ROG Phone 5: Available at Rs 49,999

After 10% off on the original price, Asus ROG Phone 5 is selling at Rs 49,999. The smartphone is powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 888 processor and has a refresh rate of 144Hz.

Google Pixel 4a : Available at Rs 29,999

After a discount of 2,000, Google Pixel 4a is available at Rs 29,999. The handset is powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 730 processor and is equipped with 6GB RAM.

Samsung Galaxy Fold 2: Available at Rs 1,49,999

Samsung Galaxy Fold 2 is selling at a discounted price of Rs 1,49,999 in the ongoing sale. The phone comes powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 865+ processor and offers 12GB RAM.
Title: Flagship Fest on Flipkart: Discount on iPhone 12, Asus ROG Phone 5, Motorola Razr, Google Pixel 4a and other smartphones

Description: Vivo, the BBK-owned smartphone brand, has announced that its flagship X series smartphones will be eligible for major Android OS upgrades and security updates for three years. “The premium X series models that are not eligible will continue to receive regular Android security updates,” said Vivo.
Text:
Vivo, the BBK-owned smartphone brand, has announced that its flagship X series smartphones will be eligible for major Android OS upgrades and security updates for three years.

This, however, will be applicable to “selected models launching after July 2021.” Therefore the current X-series models — Vivo X60 Pro+, Vivo X60 Pro, Vivo X60, Vivo X50, Vivo X50 Pro and Vivo X21 — that are available in India are not part of this commitment.

“The premium X series models that are not eligible will continue to receive regular Android security updates ,” said Vivo.

The company also confirmed that policy covers the future handsets in the Indian, European and Australian markets.

OnePlus, another BBK-owned smartphone brand already offers 3 years of major security updates to smartphones in India.

After ignoring it for years, regular security updates have now increasingly become a parameter that smartphone brands have started giving importance to.

Just last month, South Korean technology brand LG also confirmed that it will provide future Android updates to its smartphones despite the exit.

The company confirmed that LG Velvet, LG Wing and G and V series from 2019 or later will get three Android updates from the year of their release. On the other hand, some 2020 models like LG Stylo and K series will receive two software updates.

Earlier this year, Samsung also announced that it will now offer four years of security updates on many of its Android devices, along with three years of major OS updates.
Title: Vivo promises three years of Android OS upgrades to these smartphones

Description: Sometime in 2019, Microsoft had spoken about Windows 10X, a lighter version of Windows which could take on ChromeOS. The idea may have been been shelved for good.
Text:
Sometime in 2019, Microsoft had spoken about Windows 10X, a lighter version of Windows which could take on Chr... Read More

Google’s bet on Chromebooks — relying heavily on the excellent ChromeOS — seems to have paid off handsomely. Sometime in 2019, Microsoft had spoken about Windows 10X, a lighter version of Windows which could take on ChromeOS. However, it looks like Microsoft may have dropped the idea of readying an answer to Chromebooks. A report by The Verge says that 2021 will not see the arrival of Windows 10X. Further, it says that Windows 10X may not ever come and Microsoft could include some features of Windows 10X into Windows 10.

Windows 10X was being designed as a direct competitor to ChromeOS. It reportedly would’ve had a new simple user interface, the Start menu would’ve been different among other features. Microsoft’s idea was to have a toned-down cloud-based version of Windows. However, it does look like the idea has been shelved.

It was no surprise to see Microsoft working on ChromeOS rival as Chromebooks really seem to have taken off in the last year. “Chromebooks are well and truly a mainstream computing product now,” said Brian Lynch, Canalys Research Analyst. “While the education sector still accounts for the majority of shipments, their popularity with consumers and traditional commercial customers has reached new heights over the course of the last year.”

Chromebook shipments grew as much as by 275% in Q1 of 2021. Lynch of Canalys added in a press release that “Google is now in a strong position to work with its OEM partners and the channel to cement a rosy future for Chromebooks. A substantial messaging and evangelisation push coupled with the targeting of growth trends, such as flexible work arrangements and budget-conscious SMBs, will be vital to ensure the longevity of Chromebooks’ success.”
Title: Microsoft may have ‘killed’ Windows’ answer to Chromebooks

Description: Samsung has already confirmed that it will not launch a new Galaxy Note smartphone this year. The company aims to bring its S Pen experience to other high-end smartphones and is focusing a lot on the new foldable Galaxy Z series smartphones
Text:
NEW DELHI: Consumer electronics giant Samsung has already confirmed that it will not launch a new Galaxy Note smartphone this year. The company aims to bring its S Pen experience to other high-end smartphones and is focusing a lot on the new foldable Galaxy Z series smartphones.

According to a new report by Yonhap News, Samsung is expected to hold a Galaxy Unpacked event in mid-August where the company is said to launch the Galaxy Z Fold 3, Galaxy Z Flip 3 and the Galaxy S21 FE.

Earlier rumour revealed that the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 3 and Galaxy Z Fold 3 would launch in July. But the new phones will allegedly be released in August along with the Galaxy S21 FE and will help in filling the gap which will be left by Galaxy Note.

Another online report by LetsGoDigital revealed that the Galaxy Z Flip 3 is expected to come with S Pen support. The report claims that Samsung filed for a trademark with European Union Intellectual Property Office last week. The trademark filed under Class 9 has “smartphones, tablets, protective covers; electronic pen; capacitive stylus” as its description.

The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 3 is expected to be priced around $1,099 (Rs 80,770).

Meanwhile, the Samsung Galaxy S21 FE will go into mass production in July and it is rumoured to launch in August this year. The smartphone is said to come in Gray, Light Green, Light Violet and White colour options.

As per leaks and rumours, the Samsung Galaxy S21 FE will follow similar design aesthetics as the Galaxy S21 series. Samsung Galaxy S21 FE is said to sport a 6.4-inch AMOLED display. The display is also expected to house a 32MP punch-hole selfie camera.

The smartphone is expected to be either powered by Exynos 2100 or Qualcomm Snapdragon 888 processor. The handset is said to be backed by a 4500mAh battery.
Title: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip3 and Galaxy Z Fold3 expected to launch in August Galaxy Unpacked event

Description: The first Samsung smartphone with 7000mAh battery -- Galaxy M51 — has received its second price drop. Launched last year, the company has reduced the price of Galaxy M51 for the second time.
Text:
NEW DELHI: The first Samsung smartphone with 7000mAh battery -- Galaxy M51 — has received its second price drop. Launched last year, the company has reduced the price of Galaxy M51 for the second time.

Samsung Galaxy M51 received its first price drop of Rs 2,000 in October last year. After the first price cut, the 6GB RAM variant was available at Rs 22,999, while the 8GB RAM version was selling at Rs 24,999. Now the company has once again reduced the price of this mid-range smartphone.

Samsung Galaxy M51 has now witnessed a price drop of Rs 3,000. The customers can now purchase the 6GB RAM and 128GB storage variant at Rs 19,999 and the 8GB RAM and 128GB variant at Rs 21,999. The USP of the smartphone is its 7000mAh battery and reverse charging capability.

Samsung Galaxy M51 specifications

Samsung Galaxy M51 sports a 6.7-inch Infinity O display which is protected with a layer of Corning Gorilla Glass on top. The smartphone is powered by an octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 730G processor paired with Adreno 618 GPU.

The smartphone now runs Android 11 topped with the company's own layer of One UI. The smartphone comes with reverse charging capability and comes with a 25W fast charger. The company claims that the smartphone can charge completely in less than 2 hours.

Samsung Galaxy M51 comes in two RAM variants -- 6GB and 8GB. The smartphone offers 129GB internal storage which can be expanded further by installing a microSD card.

Coming to the camera, the Samsung Galaxy M51 sports a quad-rear camera setup which comprises a 64MP main sensor with LED flash, 12MP ultra-wide-angle lens, 5MP depth sensor and 5MP macro sensor. The front is home to a 32MP selfie shooter with f/2.2 aperture.

The dual SIM smartphone comes equipped with a side-mounted fingerprint sensor.
Title: Samsung Galaxy M51 price slashed in India

Description: While the impact has been limited so far, some energy analysts warned of possible shortages and higher prices as the suspension continues.
Text:
HOUSTON — The operator of the largest petroleum pipeline between Texas and New York, which was shut down after a ransomware attack, declined on Sunday to say when it would reopen, raising concerns about a critical piece of infrastructure that carries nearly half of the East Coast’s fuel supplies.

While the shutdown has so far had little impact on supplies of gasoline, diesel or jet fuel, some energy analysts warned that a prolonged suspension could raise prices at the pump along the East Coast and leave some smaller airports scrambling for jet fuel.

Colonial Pipeline, the pipeline operator, said on Sunday afternoon that it was developing “a system restart plan” and would restore service to some small lines between terminals and delivery points but “will bring our full system back online only when we believe it is safe to do so.”

The company, which shut down the pipeline on Friday, acknowledged on Saturday that it had been the victim of a ransomware attack by a criminal group, meaning that the hacker may hold the company’s data hostage until it pays a ransom. Colonial Pipeline, which is privately held, would not say whether it had paid a ransom. By failing to state a timeline for reopening on Sunday, the company renewed questions about whether the operations of the pipeline could still be in jeopardy.
Title: Hacked Pipeline May Stay Shut for Days, Raising Concerns About Fuel Supply

Text: "Video is prolific in the UK, but one of the problems today is that the investigator has to go and find all the people who have CCTV cameras around the incident, knock on their doors asking for their footage, and talk to citizens taking video on their phones," says Nice's executive vice president Christopher Wooten.
Title: The tech helping emergency responders save lives in the pandemic
